text: Skip (est. in 2017) is a San Francisco-based company which provides a scooter- sharing system in four American cities. The company was founded by Matt Tran, Mike Wadhera, and Sanjay Dastoor during Y Combinator's winter 2018 class. Skip differentiates itself from competitors by making sturdier scooters with larger batteries, offering instructional classes, and working with cities before rolling out. == History == A pair of Skip scooters in Clarendon, Arlington, Virginia Skip was founded as Waybots in winter 2017 by the creators of Boosted Board, as higher-end competitor to other scooter-sharing systems. In May 2018, Skip raised a $6M seed round of funding. In June 2018, the company raised an additional $25M in its Series A round. == Areas served == In February 2018, then Waybots launched in its first city, Washington, D.C., as part of a pilot program. At the end of August 2018, the city of San Francisco gave Skip and Scoot permission to operate dockless scooters in the city. In an email sent out October 15, 2019 to its members, Skip announced that their scooters "will no longer be rentable as part of SFMTA’s Powered Scooter Share Program for 2019-2020" effective immediately. Skip has reportedly requested an appeal of SFMTA's decision, in order to continue operations in San Francisco. Between June and July 2019, Skip launched in San Diego, CA and Austin, TX. == References == ==External links== * Category:Scooter sharing companies Category:Y Combinator companies Category:Companies based in San Francisco Category:American companies established in 2017 Category:Transportation in San Diego Category:Transportation in Austin, Texas Category:Transportation in San Francisco Category:Transportation in Washington, D.C. title: Skip (company)
